intellectual property.translation[0].def: something which someone has invented or has the right to make or sell, especially something that cannot legally be copied by other people
intellectual property.translation[1].def: an idea, design, or artistic work which a person or organization has invented or created and on which they have obtained a COPYRIGHT, TRADEMARK, or PATENT

The country’s indifference to  (=lack of caring about) copyright protection not only hurts foreign creators of intellectual property, such as software makers, but it discourages home-grown creativity too.
Microsoft’s regional manager for intellectual property rights
